content.description: Start from a sitting position with your right hand in small pocket jug and left hand on a bad sloping pinch. There are two tiny foot holds from which to push off of. There is a good heel hook on the rail for the start of Looks Easy. The route fallows the line up and slightly left using the slopers on the left of the boulder for compression up to a big move(crux) to a left facing ledge.
content.location: The route is on the left side of the downhill facing face on the Grit Block.   Start from sit. Right hand small jug, left hand bad sloping pinch.   Walk off is around back of the boulder

content.description:
Start on the obvious rail to the right, use a good heel hook to proceed straight up past good slopers to the lip. 

  Crux is the first move
content.location: If looking at The Grit Block face this climb is on the right side

content.description: Just under the far left of the Three Kings on the hill in the Boulder Gardens, there are two squairish boulders, this is the lower of the two. The landing has been improved with stacked rocks. This boulder offers unusually good slopers without the the "sandy" feel of other boulders.
